poem:
**Unspoken Voices**

In a quiet barrack's corner,  
where silence once ruled with iron,  
two voices rise like dawn.  
No longer bound by shadows,  
their stories break the morning—  
unraveled ribbons of truth  
spilling into the sunlit air,  
echoing beyond the keep  
of unwritten laws.  
Freedom whispers  
in every unsaid word.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK minister admits rules banning armed forces from speaking out are unlawful The UK defence secretary, John Healey, has conceded that policies that banned members of the armed forces from speaking to the press or MPs without permission are unlawful, after a legal challenge was brought by two women who complained they were raped while serving. The women, from the RAF and Royal Navy, argued the restrictive regulations had prevented them from speaking out publicly". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
